metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10045 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The isMail transport in PHPMailer before 5.2.20 might allow remoteattackers to pass extra parameters to the mail command and consequentlyexecute arbitrary code by leveraging improper interaction between theescapeshellarg function and internal escaping performed in the mailfunction in PHP. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrectfix for CVE-2016-10033.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 5.2.14+dfsg-2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.14+dfsg-2.1').
